attributes.action: replace unemployment benefit with utility bill vouchers and food stamps
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
There is little incentive for the unemployed to actively seek work, when they can mooch off the state, and spend their benefits on frivolities like alcohol, widescreen TVs, games consoles, and quite often drugs.

Instead, it would make sense to make payment direct to energy and other utilities, and instead of money, issue food stamps that can only be spent on essential food - but expressly not redeemable against luxuries like alcohol, tobacco, and consumer electronics (even where sold in foodstores such as Asda or Lidl).
